title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that IWK Bank’s liabilities increased by $8,000 and/or does not explain that checking accounts are demand deposits, which are liabilities to commercial banks.
The response states that IWK Bank’s liabilities increased by $8,000 and explains that checking accounts are demand deposits, which are liabilities to commercial banks.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate the change in IWK Bank’s required reserves as $2,000 and/or does not show the work.

Change in Required Reserves=$8,000×25%=$2,000 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5CF4@

The response calculates the change in IWK Bank’s required reserves as $2,000 and shows the work.

Change in Required Reserves=$8,000×25%=$2,000 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5CF4@ the work.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that the dollar value of the maximum amount of new loans IWK Bank can initially make is $6,000 and/or does not explain that IWK Bank can lend out its excess reserves, which are $6,000 ( =$8,000−$2,000 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4090@ ).

The response states that the dollar value of the maximum amount of new loans IWK Bank can initially make is $6,000 and explains that IWK Bank can lend out its excess reserves, which are $6,000 ( =$8,000−$2,000 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4090@ ).

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate the maximum amount by which the money supply can increase throughout the banking system as $32,000 and/or does not show the work.

Change in Bank's Reserves×Money Multiplier=$8,000× 1 0.25 =$32,000 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@6DFB@

OR

Change in Excess Reserves×Money Multiplier+Initial Deposit =$6,000× 1 0.25 +$8,000=$32,000 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@8371@

The response calculates the maximum amount by which the money supply can increase throughout the banking system as $32,000 and shows the work.

Change in Bank's Reserves×Money Multiplier=$8,000× 1 0.25 =$32,000 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@6DFB@

OR

Change in Excess Reserves×Money Multiplier+Initial Deposit=$6,000× 1 0.25 +$8,000=$32,000 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@81E6@

title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that aggregate demand and the price level will increase and/or does not explain that the increase in the money supply will result in a decrease in nominal interest rates, an increase in interest-sensitive spending, an increase in aggregate demand, and an increase in the price level.

The response states that aggregate demand and the price level will increase and explains that the increase in the money supply will result in a decrease in nominal interest rates, an increase in interest-sensitive spending, an increase in aggregate demand, and an increase in the price level.
